_1: ^Do you mind dropping me off at 270 Ardendale?
^Er- Do you know where that is?
^It's okay! Feel free to use the GPS on your dashboard!
^You won't make it as a taxi driver if you don't know where you're going.
^It's a harsh world out there for you taxi drivers!
^Consider it a pet theory of mine.
^It seems true though, don't you think?

c-0: ^I couldn't tell it was you from back here, but that voice...
c-1: ^I couldn't tell it was you from back here, but that voice...
c-2: ^I couldn't tell it was you from back here, but that silence...

p1: ^I heard you were back in town, but I didn't believe it.
^You've almost been gone for a full year y'know?
^So you're a taxi driver now huh?
^Honestly, this job seems to suit you well.
^This is your old car from way back then, isn't it?
^Y'know, I remember how broken it used to be.
^Your AC was all rickety and couldn't keep a temperature...
^All of your passengers are gonna have a preference for that kind of thing y'know?
^Make sure everything is set to maximize their comfort!
^Plus, if things start breaking, you gotta fix it!
^Honestly, it's a surprise this piece of junk still drives.
^Don't get me wrong, the paint job really did wonders.
^But, maybe you should've paid for some maintenance first haha!
^Driving around like this...It's a bit nostalgic isn't it?
^Well, at least it is to me.
^Do you remember when you first got your license?

c-0: ^Haha! It was like I was seeing a whole different side of you!
^I'd never seen you giddy like that before.
c-1: ^Don’t get shy now you liar, I know you remember.

p2: ^You'd come to my house every day and drive me around town for hours.
^I wouldn't know when you'd come. From dusk to dawn—it was really whenever.
^I just remember talking about our lives, our dreams, and the future.
^Honestly, you're lucky my mom's known you your whole life.
^She told me you shouldn't play with a young maiden's heart like that!
^As much as I like to tease, it really is nice to see you again!
^Y'know, the town hasn't changed much since you've been gone.
^Mackenzie's just that kind of place I guess.
^I can kind of understand why you left.
^The same ol' hustle and bustle leaves a bitter taste in your mouth.
^Sorry, maybe we should talk about this next time.
^Plus, my stop is coming up soon.
^Let's do this again sometime. I had a lot of fun!
^I'm glad that I got to see you again after so long!
^Hopefully, you feel the same way! Hehe.
^<glitch>It's been a while since you've been here hasn't it?</glitch>

^<glitch>Consider it a pet theory of mine.</glitch>
^<glitch>It seems true though, don't you think?</glitch>

p5: ^Y'know, the town hasn't changed much since you've been gone.
^Mackenzie's just that kind of place I guess.

c-0: ^For some reason, I expected a diferent answer.
^Sometimes it's nice to find peace in the familiar.
^No matter what path you pick, I'll always be there to support you.
^Although...I don't think your journey is quite over yet.
^Looks like it's time for me to go.
c-1: ^There was this weird girl...She just moved in recently.

p6: ^Well, that's interesting. It kind of makes me happy to hear.
^Before I go, I just wanted to thank you for everything.
^I don't know the next time I'll see you, but it'll probably be a while.
^I wish I could have met Lucy.
^I wish I could have talked more with Old Man McGee.
^I wish I could have gone to Kim's party.
^I wish I could have pet Romeo another time.
^Even now, McGee still talks to you.
p7: ^Thank you. You always know the right thing to say even though you're silent half the time...
^Although, that's just what makes you, you.
^Looks like it's time for me to go.
